column4: Can someone please help me with installing a control theme for GNOME?
don't you just drag and drop the file into the theme manager?
Maybe that would work if this came with an .xml file, but this is just a bunch of .png images and a gtkrc.txt file.
I'd suggest just googling to hell and back
since no one is helping you here. And you've been asking for a while.
I did. I got this. http://library.gnome.org/admin/system-admin-guide/stable/themes-3.html.en It doesn't really help.
I thought that the directory had to exist in order for that to work, but there's no pixmaps directory... I suppose I'll try creating it.
I did, and it doesn't show up in the Appearances window.
And after creating a pixmaps folder and dropping the files in there, then switching to the theme, I see no change.
